data.title: Nature of triangles
data.statement:
You have to output the nature of the triangles whose vertices’ coordinates are given. The output should follow this format:

[[Name of triangle]] {{is a/an}} [[side nature]] {{and a/an}} [[angle nature]] {{triangle.}}

[[Name of triangle]] follows the same order as the vertices given.

[[Side nature]] is:
• “{{scalene}}” if all sides have different lengths, or
• “{{isosceles in [[vertex]]}}” if exactly two sides have the same length and they have a common vertex of [[vertex]].

[[Angle nature]] is:
• “{{acute}}” if all angles are acute, or
• “{{right in [[vertex]]}}” if the angle at [[vertex]] is 90°, or
• “{{obtuse in [[vertex]] ([[degrees]]°)}}” if the angle at [[vertex]] is obtuse. In this case, output the measure of the obtuse angle in [[degrees]], rounded to the nearest integer.

<<Output examples>>
BAC is a scalene and a right in A triangle.
DEF is an isosceles in D and an obtuse in D (120°) triangle.

testCases.title: Scalene triangles
testCases.testOut:
ABC is a scalene and an obtuse in A (176°) triangle.
OAB is a scalene and an acute triangle.

testCases.title: Scalene triangles
testCases.testOut:
DEF is a scalene and an obtuse in E (162°) triangle.
MNP is a scalene and an obtuse in P (117°) triangle.

testCases.title: Isosceles triangles
testCases.testOut:
DOG is an isosceles in O and an obtuse in O (127°) triangle.
CAT is an isosceles in C and an acute triangle.

testCases.title: Isosceles triangles
testCases.testOut:
RAT is an isosceles in T and an acute triangle.
CAB is an isosceles in A and a right in A triangle.

testCases.title: Right angled triangles
testCases.testOut:
OIJ is an isosceles in O and a right in O triangle.
HOG is a scalene and a right in G triangle.

testCases.title: Right angled triangles
testCases.testOut:
DEF is a scalene and a right in E triangle.
GHK is an isosceles in G and a right in G triangle.

testCases.title: Almost right
testCases.testOut: ABC is a scalene and an acute triangle.

testCases.title: Almost right
testCases.testOut: ABC is a scalene and an acute triangle.

testCases.title: Everything
testCases.testOut:
ACD is a scalene and a right in D triangle.
ABC is a scalene and an acute triangle.
COG is an isosceles in O and a right in O triangle.
BCD is an isosceles in C and an acute triangle.
DEF is a scalene and an obtuse in E (162°) triangle.

testCases.title: Everything
testCases.testOut:
ABD is a scalene and a right in D triangle.
ABC is an isosceles in C and an acute triangle.
MNP is a scalene and an obtuse in P (128°) triangle.

data.constraints:
1 ⩽ [[N]] ⩽ 8
-20 ⩽ [[x]], [[y]] ⩽ 20
[[x]] and [[y]] are integers.
Degenerate triangles do not appear in this puzzle.
Equilateral triangles do not appear in this puzzle because they involve non-integer coordinates (calculation involves √3).
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read A:word(1) xA:int yA:int B:word(1) xB:int yB:int C:word(1) xC:int yC:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of triangles.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Each [[vertex]] followed by its [[x]] and [[y]] coordinates, one triangle per line.
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines:>> The nature of the triangles, one triangle per line, in the same order as the input.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have to output the nature of the triangles whose vertices’ coordinates are given. The output should follow this format:

Name of triangle is a/an side nature and a/an angle nature triangle.

Name of triangle follows the same order as the vertices given.

Side nature is:
• “scalene” if all sides have different lengths, or
• “isosceles in vertex” if exactly two sides have the same length and they have a common vertex of vertex.

Angle nature is:
• “acute” if all angles are acute, or
• “right in vertex” if the angle at vertex is 90°, or
• “obtuse in vertex (degrees°)” if the angle at vertex is obtuse. In this case, output the measure of the obtuse angle in degrees, rounded to the nearest integer.

Output examples
BAC is a scalene and a right in A triangle.
DEF is an isosceles in D and an obtuse in D (120°) triangle.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of triangles.
Next N lines: Each vertex followed by its x and y coordinates, one triangle per line.
Output
N lines: The nature of the triangles, one triangle per line, in the same order as the input.
Constraints
1 ⩽ N ⩽ 8
-20 ⩽ x, y ⩽ 20
x and y are integers.
Degenerate triangles do not appear in this puzzle.
Equilateral triangles do not appear in this puzzle because they involve non-integer coordinates (calculation involves √3).
Example
Input
2
A 5 -2 B 8 2 C -1 -9
O 0 0 A 3 0 B 1 2
Output
ABC is a scalene and an obtuse in A (176°) triangle.
OAB is a scalene and an acute triangle.
